label: A2B13C6D_hP44_182_bc_a2i_i_d-001
title: Na$_{2}$Co$_{2}$TeO$_{6}$ Structure
comments:
(Viciu, 2007) find that the four sodium atoms in the primitive cell are distributed over the 26 sites available:  The (2a) site has 11\% occupancy, the first (Na-II) (12i) site has 8.1\% occupancy, and the second (Na-III) has 23.4\% occupancy. (Xiao, 2019) present a slightly different structure, where all of the sodium atoms are on a (6g) site [ $(x,0,0)$, $x = 0.32$ ], which is 1/3 vacant.  In both cases all of the sodium atoms are near the $z = 0$ and $z = 1/2$ planes. 
 We have shifted the origin by 1/2 {\bf a$_3$} from that of (Viciu, 2007).
